intro: Nemophila atomaria, commonly known as the dwarf blue-eyed Mary, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky areas. It has hairy stems and leaves, and its flowers bloom in early spring. Nemophila atomaria is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
